title: How to Delete Your PayPal Account Through the Website or Mobile App

steps.title: Go to the PayPal website and log into your account.
steps.content: Go to the PayPal website and log into your account. Then click on Log in in the window's upper-right corner and enter the email associated with your account and your password into the labeled fields. Click on Log In to access your account. [1] X Research source You can use any web browser to close your PayPal account.

steps.title: Withdraw all money in your PayPal account.
steps.content: Withdraw all money in your PayPal account. Before you can close the account, you must verify it and transfer all remaining funds to your bank or a different PayPal account. Contact PayPal’s customer service if you need a check for the remaining balance instead. [2] X Research source Consider making a copy of your PayPal transaction history before closing the account since your history will be deleted along with the account. To do this, navigate to Activity (on your account home page), then click the Download icon > All transactions > Download all.

steps.title: Pay off any remaining balances and cancel your recurring payments.
steps.content: Pay off any remaining balances and cancel your recurring payments. Your account can’t be closed if there are unresolved issues, such as a dispute, pending transaction, or scheduled recurring payments. Resolve all outstanding balances you owe and any other potential account issues before attempting to delete the account. Remember: if you have any questions or need help resolving an issue, you can always contact PayPal’s customer service.

steps.title: Click on (the gear icon).
steps.content: Click on (the gear icon). You'll find this gear icon in the upper-right corner of the window on your PayPal account homepage (the page that opens when you log in). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the ACCOUNT tab and select Close your account.
steps.content: Navigate to the ACCOUNT tab and select Close your account . The Account tab is in the menu that runs horizontally across the top of your window, next to SECURITY , PAYMENTS , and NOTIFICATIONS . Scroll down, and you’ll find the Close your account button under the "Account options" section.

steps.title: Review the "Before you close your account..." page.
steps.content: Review the "Before you close your account..." page. When you select "Close your account," a new pop-up page will appear, explaining that PayPal will send all final docs related to your account to the email address set as your primary email. If you need to change your primary email, you can go back and do it on the ACCOUNT tab. [4] X Research source You can also contact PayPal's customer service from this page if you have any questions or ask PayPal to delete your account data. There are links for both on the page. You may also be prompted to enter your bank account number if you have an attached account. However, if you don't see this prompt, you can proceed with the next step as usual.

steps.title: Click Close Account to permanently close the account.
steps.content: Click Close Account to permanently close the account. At the bottom of the pop-up page, you'll see a Close Account button; when you're ready, click on it. From there, your PayPal account will be closed, and you'll get an email confirmation of the action. Congratulations! You’ve successfully deleted your PayPal account. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Download and log into the PayPal mobile app.
steps.content: Download and log into the PayPal mobile app . Download the PayPal app on your mobile device if you haven't already. Open the app, enter the email address and password associated with your account as prompted, then tap Log in .

steps.title: Tap the profile icon at the top left corner of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon at the top left corner of the screen. You'll be taken to your account homepage in the app when you log in. Look at the top-left corner of the screen, and you should see a circular icon featuring the profile photo associated with your account; click on it to proceed.

steps.title: Scroll down and select the Close your account option.
steps.content: Scroll down and select the Close your account option. Your profile page will show your name, photo, and a list of options (like Account info, Login and security, and so on). Scroll until you see Close your account and tap on it. Then, when prompted on the page that opens, select Close account to finalize the action. [6] X Research source Remember you’ll still need to clear any outstanding payments, remaining balances, or account issues before closing your PayPal account through the mobile app!

steps.title: No, deactivated PayPal accounts are permanently deleted.
steps.content: No, deactivated PayPal accounts are permanently deleted. That’s why saving any records you might need later is so important; otherwise, consider leaving the account open if you know you’ll need it in the future. Once it’s gone, you can’t reopen it. You’ll need to make an entirely new account to use PayPal once your old account is deleted. [7] X Research source Closing your PayPal account won’t cancel any subscriptions or recurring payments to third parties, so sort them out before closing your account.

steps.title: Explore other payment apps if you decide to leave PayPal.
steps.content: Explore other payment apps if you decide to leave PayPal. Do you still need a platform you can use to send or receive money after closing out your PayPal account? There are several notable and popular alternatives, so weigh your options and pick the one that best fits your needs: Venmo . Venmo is a popular, widespread payment app that allows you to send or receive money via bank account, credit card, or Venmo account balance. Cash App . Cash App is another popular payment app that can send or receive money via bank account, credit card, or account balance. It also offers savings opportunities from different vendors. Zelle . Zelle is a payment app compatible with many banks and credit unions, and it’s known for its quick transfer times, although it only works domestically (not internationally). Stripe . Stripe is a commonly used payment platform for businesses; its pricing is competitive and very customizable. Square . Square is an excellent platform for small businesses because it offers competitive, transparent pricing and a free version with many options. Skrill . Skrill is another platform for businesses that offers competitive pricing and service in over 200 countries. Wise . Wise can send and receive money internationally, with low exchange rates and maintenance fees.
